title: Pudgy Party
subtitle: A fast-paced, arcade-style game featuring licensed NFL teams and players.
description: Pudgy Party was my second title at Mythical Games. I joined mid-development and spent my early time ramping up on an unfamiliar codebase.
I worked with Unity running as a headless distributed Linux server for multiplayer, and Beamable as a backend service layer.
I took ownership of the Shop and Battle Pass, improving the experience with intuitive auto-scroll mechanics and building a reveal animation for new Battle Pass seasons.
The shop had performance issues â€” I reduced load times by 50% by tracking down hidden UI elements that were performing unnecessary async work in the background.

I also led a large-scale refactor of the shop, restructuring the data architecture to support reusable content scheduling for live ops while closing security vulnerabilities that let purchase limits and item costs be bypassed.
A lot of my time went into bug fixing and stabilisation, particularly issues caused by the front and back end falling out of sync.
I integrated animations built in Unity Animator into game features, hooking up logic-dependent sequences and the Battle Pass reveal flow.
I was in the early stages of re-designing an existing system prior to the end of my time on this project.
